place.name: KILTON
place.gazetteerText: KILTON, a parish in Williton district, Somerset; on the coast, 6 miles E by N of Watchet r. station. Posttown, Kilve, under Bridgewater. Acres, 1, 691; of which 140 are water. Real property, £1, 510. Pop., 174. Houses, 31. The property is divided among a few. The manor and much of the land belong to H. F. Luttrell, Esq. The living is a vicarage in the diocese of Bath and Wells. Value, £213.* Patron, the Lord Chancellor. The church is plain, and has a tower. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
